concise_definition: v. 保证, 确保, 使确信

definitions.explanation_en: To tell someone confidently that something is true or will happen, in order to remove doubt or anxiety.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以自信的语气告诉某人某事是真实的或一定会发生，以消除其疑虑或焦虑。
definitions.example_en: The manager assured the clients that their data would be completely secure.
definitions.example_cn: 经理向客户保证，他们的数据将得到完全保护。

definitions.explanation_en: To make someone feel certain or confident about a situation, often through reassurance or promise.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过保证或安抚使某人对某种情况感到确信或安心。
definitions.example_en: She assured him that everything would work out fine in the end.
definitions.example_cn: 她向他保证，最终一切都会好起来的。

definitions.explanation_en: To guarantee or pledge something formally, often in a contractual or official context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在正式或合同语境中，对某事作出担保或承诺。
definitions.example_en: The contract assures the supplier a steady stream of orders for the next year.
definitions.example_cn: 合同保证供应商在未来一年内获得稳定的订单。

comparison.analysis: “Guarantee” (担保) 比 “assure” 更具法律或正式约束力，常用于承诺结果或责任的承担，如产品保修或财务担保。而 “assure” 更侧重于心理层面的安抚，不一定具有法律效力。
“Promise” (承诺) 强调说话者主动做出的未来行为的承诺，常带有个人责任或道德义务。“Assure” 则更侧重于消除听者的疑虑，其对象通常是对方的情绪或信心，而非行为本身。
“Convince” (使信服) 强调通过逻辑、证据或论证使对方接受某种观点或事实，是一个认知层面的改变。“Assure” 则是通过语言安抚情绪，使对方感到安心，不必然改变其认知，而是减轻其担忧。
